content: I'm feeling pretty good about the negotiation process so far. The seller has agreed to fix the minor issues with the plumbing and electrical systems, which is a big relief. I just want to make sure they follow through on their commitments and that the work is done correctly. I'm planning to schedule a final walk-through inspection before closing to verify that everything is in order. Do you think I should also consider getting a third-party contractor to review the repairs and provide an independent assessment?
